title: Brocard's conjecture
summary: In number theory, Brocard's conjecture is the conjecture that there are at least four prime numbers between (pn)2 and (pn+1)2, where pn is the nth prime number, for every n â‰¥ 2.[1]  The conjecture is named after Henri Brocard.  It is widely believed that this conjecture is true. However, it remains unproven as of 2022.
